title.value: Fairness Through Domain Awareness: Mitigating Popularity Bias For Music Discovery
title.justification: The title explicitly states the main focus of the research, which includes fairness, domain awareness, and mitigating popularity bias in music discovery.
title.quote: Fairness Through Domain Awareness: Mitigating Popularity Bias For Music Discovery

extractions.description: The paper addresses popularity bias in music recommender systems and proposes a domain-aware, individual fairness-based approach using graph neural network (GNN) based recommender systems. The proposed BOOST methodology is applied to enhance music discovery and mitigate popularity bias by leveraging ground truth listening experiences.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments using datasets and compares the performance of the proposed approach with existing fairness benchmarks. Hence, it is an empirical study.
type.quote: In this work we explore the intrinsic relationship between music discovery and popularity bias. To mitigate this issue we propose a domain-aware, individual fairness-based approach... our analysis explains why our proposed methodology is a novel and promising approach...

primary_research_field.justification: The paper discusses the application of deep learning techniques in recommender systems using graph neural networks and other models.
primary_research_field.quote: To mitigate this issue we propose a domain-aware, individual fairness-based approach which addresses popularity bias in graph neural network (GNNs) based recommender systems.

sub_research_fields.justification: The main focus of the paper is on music recommender systems and mitigating the popularity bias within them.
sub_research_fields.quote: As online music platforms grow, music recommender systems play a vital role in helping users navigate and discover content within their vast musical databases.

name.justification: BOOST is introduced as a novel methodological approach to mitigate popularity bias by leveraging individual fairness within graph neural network based recommender systems.
name.quote: we propose a domain-aware, individual fairness-based approach which addresses popularity bias in graph neural network (GNNs) based recommender systems. Our approach uses individual fairness to reflect a ground truth listening experience... We apply our BOOST methodology to two discovery based tasks...

caracteristics.justification: BOOST was developed as a recommender system approach that focuses on individual fairness and mitigating popularity bias.
caracteristics.quote: In this work we propose a novel technical formulation of popularity bias and design a domain-aware ranking based individual fairness approach to mitigating popularity bias in graph-based recommendation.

name.justification: PinSage is mentioned as an industry solution to graph-based recommendation and serves as the backbone recommender model in the experiments.
name.quote: In particular, PinSage is an industry solution to graph-based recommendation. Unlike many competing methods, which train on the entire neighborhood set of a node, PinSage trains on a randomly sampled subset of the graph.

caracteristics.justification: PinSage is a GNN-based model used for recommendation tasks.
caracteristics.quote: In particular, PinSage is an industry solution to graph-based recommendation.

name.justification: LightGCN is used as a backbone recommender for comparison with fairness mitigation techniques.
name.quote: Meanwhile, LightGCN, is a method that learns both user and item embeddings simultaneously. Since its proposal in 2020, it is still considered state of the art.

caracteristics.justification: LightGCN is a GNN-based model used in recommender systems.
caracteristics.quote: Meanwhile, LightGCN, is a method that learns both user and item embeddings simultaneously.

name.justification: BERT is used to process song titles into embeddings for feature augmentation.
name.quote: For each song in the dataset, we extract the song title and pass it through a pre-trained language transformer model, BERT, into an embedding of dimension 512.

caracteristics.justification: BERT, a well-known transformer model, is used for processing text data.
caracteristics.quote: we extract the song title and pass it through a pre-trained language transformer model, BERT

name.justification: ResNet50 is used for processing album artwork into embeddings.
name.quote: For each song in the dataset we extract the associated album artwork. We pass this image through a pre-trained convolutional neural network, ResNet50, to generate an embedding of dimension 1024.

caracteristics.justification: ResNet50, a well-known CNN model, is used for image processing tasks.
caracteristics.quote: We pass this image through a pre-trained convolutional neural network, ResNet50

name.justification: LastFM is used as one of the datasets for experimenting with music recommendations.
name.quote: One of the preliminary steps of our work was the extensive augmentation of two publicly available datasets: LastFM and the Million Playlist Dataset.

name.justification: MPD is used as another dataset for experimenting with music recommendations.
name.quote: One of the preliminary steps of our work was the extensive augmentation of two publicly available datasets: LastFM and the Million Playlist Dataset.

name.justification: PyTorch is listed as the machine learning library used for implementing the models.
name.quote: All models mentioned were implemented using PyTorch as the deep learning library.

name.justification: Spotipy is used for retrieving data from the Spotify API.
name.quote: We augment both of our datasets to include a rich set of features scraped from Spotify API [1].
